results.title: Why You Need Window Blinds (Even if You Don’t Think So)
results.abstract: Designers consider window shades and blinds essential for many reasons. But there are so many options — how do you choose the right ones?

media.caption: Window shades and blinds help put a finishing touch on any room. In this Harlem dining room, Sheila Bridges, the New York designer, used two layers of shades — a flat Roman shade with a translucent roller shade behind it — to control light levels.

results.title: Bobbi Ercoline, Whose Hug Became a Symbol of Woodstock, Dies at 73
results.abstract: Embracing her boyfriend, a blanket around them, she appeared on the cover of the ubiquitous soundtrack album of “Woodstock,” the 1970 documentary film about the music festival.

media.caption: Bobbi Ercoline (then Bobbi Kelly) hugging her future husband, Nick, on the cover of the “Woodstock” soundtrack album. The photograph forced her to confess to her mother that she had gone to the festival, and not to church.

results.title: To Die on Her Own Terms, a Connecticut Woman Turns to Vermont
results.abstract: Connecticut does not allow medical aid in dying, so Lynda Bluestein sued Vermont to take advantage of that state’s law. Now, legislators may make the practice more broadly available.

media.caption: Lynda Bluestein of Bridgeport, Conn., reached a settlement with Vermont to become the first nonresident with access to its medical aid in dying law.
